metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14615 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient control flow in certain data structures for some Intel(R)Processors with Intel(R) Processor Graphics may allow an unauthenticateduser to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-76.86~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-76.86~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-76.86~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1066.73
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1102.113
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1058.60~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1067.72
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1055.59
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1133-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1133.141
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-76.86~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.73').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.113').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.60~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.72').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.59').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.141').
